name: La Farge Perry House

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed 3 nights at this very delightful and centrally located B&B. The room with sitting room was very spacious and well appointed. Each afternoon we found coconut macaroons waiting on the first floor. Each morning you had the choice of 2 entrees for breakfast, cooked to order. The restaurants on the waterfront were a 10-15 min walk. Our only downside is that we had to carry our luggage to the 3rd floor. There are rooms on the 1st and 2nd floors. Our room looked out to the bridge, enabling us to see the July 4th fireworks from our room.
reviews.title: Very nice B&B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A getaway weekend at La Farge Perry House was exactly what my boyfriend and I needed. We booked through Expedia, however discovered that when booking through a third party you are limited with the selection of rooms. Midge, the Inn keeper was kind enough to move us to a bigger room with a two person Jacuzzi and beautiful canopy bed. She was very helpful regarding “things to do” and a great chef. The Inn is cozy and very welcoming. The location of the Inn is also very convenient. Jax the dog was a great addition to the experience! Thanks M & J.
reviews.title: Warm and Cozy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I've stayed at many B&Bs in Newport and elsewhere, and this is the nicest place I've every stayed at. The Oliver Hazard Perry room that we stayed in was ridiculously large and beautifully decorated, with lots of storage space. I'd like to have a room like this for my bedroom at home. Large comfortable bathroom, with Molton Brown toiletries. The innkeeper Midge is a fantastic chef and a great hostess. The entire inn is big and comfortable, with plenty of parking on-site and on the adjacent streets. The location can't be beat. Within walking distance to the high streets but far enough away to be quiet, with plenty of interesting architecture and shops on the adjacent blocks.
reviews.title: We loved it and we'll be back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: LaFarge Perry has spoiled us. After years of visiting Newport, this is now my favorite B&B.
reviews.title: One of the Best B and B's in the World

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Knowing nothing about Newport or its geography we booked this B & B based on a couple of nice pictures of it. Nothing prepared us for the beauty of the house, the quality of the rooms and the superb level of service. Everything about this establishment is excellent, and the innkeeper, Midge Knerr, is a superb host. As a former chef with many years experience Midge provided convivial and sumptuous breakfasts that surpassed many we have experienced in 5 star hotels around the world. At La Farge Perry the attention to detail is outstanding, and the bathrooms benefit from fresh towels and Molton Brown toiletries every day. We stayed initially for three days and then moved on. However, our next B & B was nowhere near the standard of La Perry so we sacrificed our prepayment there and moved back to La Perry again for another two nights. I travel the world regularly on business staying in four and five star hotels, but can wholeheartedly endorse La Farge Perry House as one of the finest and most enjoyable places I have ever stayed in.
reviews.title: We will be repeat customers!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I wanted to get away for a long weekend and have always heard wonderful things about Newport. Unbeknown to us, we went up during the Folk Festival which made the town pretty crowded but the inn was lovely. The rooms were very clean but because we booked the room on travelocity we didn't get to choose our room and ended up with two adjourning rooms. The rooms were nice but kind of seemed like a waste. The location was also very nice because while it isn't on the warf, it is nice to be away from all of the commotion. I would definitely recommend this bed and breakfast to anyone looking to go to Newport!
reviews.title: Lovely and clean bed and breakfast!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: I almost hate to write this review, as it is a gem that my sister Jenn told me about a couple of years ago. She always stays there when she is working in Newport, and had suggested that I would love it, and i do. While there is no B&B in Newport that it is inexpensive, the LaFarge Perry House is a tremendous value for the charge. Innkeeper Midge is a gracious and talented hostess, plying us at breakfast with hot coffee and teas, banana pancakes, eggs benedict, scones, beautiful fresh fruit salad, or, other special requests. She even had soy milk on hand for my daughter's cereal. Each room that I or my sister has stayed in have been special and well appointed. This weekend was especially hot, and the air conditioning kept us as cool as we wanted (and my husband likes it cold!). This special place is walking distance to restaurants, shopping and wharf, and just a short distance to Cliff Walk and the Mansions. Lastly, yummy macaroons and chocolate chip cookies greeted us in the front hallway every afternoon.
reviews.title: Fabulous LaFarge Perry House

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A lovely B&B. The inn keeper was delightful. The location was great. She made great dinner recomendations.VERY comfy bed.
reviews.title: Loved it! Great location & Inn Keeper

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our 4-night stay at the La Farge Perry House was beyond our expectation. The ambience, cleanliness, hospitality, and convient location, was only exceeded by the gracious and delightful Innkeeper, "Midge" and her delicious culinary delights !!
reviews.title: "Outstanding Experience"

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our vacation at the La Farge Perry House will be one of our most "Treasured Memories"
reviews.title: La Farge Perry House is more than a B&B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Very good access to the Mansions. Need a car to get into town - where parkig is a problem.
reviews.title: Excellent Stay - Great Innkeeper - Will Return

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the La Farge Perry House for a wedding in Newport. The house is perfectly located. It is just a short walk downtown and a short walk to all of the mansions and the Cliff Walk.
reviews.title: We loved everything about this charming B&B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: We had to stay in two separate rooms because I had originally boooked for one night but we decided to stay for two. Midge and her staff made it incredibly easy for us to switch rooms and both the rooms were immaculate with very comfortable beds. The place is incredibly well taken care of and you can tell Midge cares a lot about the property and the people who stay there!
reviews.title: Quiet, gorgeous B&B, superb breakfasts

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled solo
reviews.text: Midge's cooking every morning was delicious and the macaroons are some of the most amazing treats I have ever had. Beware, it is almost impossible to only eat one!
reviews.title: Perfect in Every Way!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would highly recommend this spot and would definitely go back! We hope to see Midge again as she helped make our stay in Newport an incredible one!
reviews.title: A wonderful home, away from home!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Stayed for one night. Arrived early and our room was ready. Very nice room, king size bed, large bath, Great AC. Breakfast was just fair. They had only one choice (French Toast and Bacon). It was very good but we were looking to have Eggs Benedict or another choice.
reviews.title: Very Nice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had read the reviews and pretty much expected a great stay. My husband calls me the queen of quaint towns and B&Bs. When we go away, I prefer boutique hotels and smaller accomodations with attention to detail. We are discerning travellers and have to say, La Farge Perry House exceeded all of our expectations. From the delicious cooked- to- order breakfast, the beautiful flowers in the rooms and common areas, Molton Brown toilettries and the yummy afternoon cookies what's not to love! Mige was very attentive yet gave us our privacy. She made lovely reccs for dinner and cocktails and we were never disappointed! We needed a relaxing getaway and this was just what the Doc ordered! Highly recc and look forward to returning.
reviews.title: Cant wait to return!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: La Farge Perry House is extremely charming, with gorgeous bedrooms, beautiful bathrooms, and expertly run by Midge Knerr who is without a doubt a fantastic cook. I always looked forward to her breakfasts made completely from scratch, and I do mean from scratch as in she makes her own muffin mix too! Her snacks and treats were terrific as well, it's an easy place to gain a few vacation pounds but totally worth it! She has a very friendly dog that will give you as little or as much attention as you desire too. The rooms and porch had plenty of comfortable furniture for relaxing. It has a good location too, within walking distance to a hotel restaurant and bar, and a bigger walk to the main attractions in Newport but one could certainly do it in 20 minutes or less. Plenty of parking here too if you plan to drive around like we did. This place gets an A+, we really did love it.
reviews.title: Wonderful, I would ONLY stay here in Newport, RI

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Beautiful accommodations inside and out. The rooms are beautiful and spacious, flowers magnificent, and the breakfast amazing! Midge Knerr, the innkeeper was pleasant and hospitible. I highly recommend the La Farge Perry.
reviews.title: Best Part of a Wonderful Trip!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The La Farge Perry House was one of the nicest bed and breakfasts we have stayed in. The rooms were beautifully decorated with memories of the Victorian age yet they had all the modern comforts. The morning breakfasts were delicious and available over a 2 hour period in the morning allowing for a flexible schedule. The neighborhood was quiet, appointed with various beautiful homes and a delightful walk into the downtown area of Newport. The innkeeper, Midge, was gracious, knowledgeable and a great cook! You can,t go wrong here. Worth a trip!
reviews.title: You will enjoy this tremendously

aka: La Farge Perry House Hotel Newport
